If you have questions, suggestions or to report problems do not reply to this message, write instead to tcoffee@googlegroups.com.
Cheers, T-Coffee team

service.name: saracoffee
service.title: SARA-Coffee
service.description: Aligns RNA sequences using tertiary structure (new)

fieldset.title: Sequences input
fieldset.description: Paste or upload your set of sequences in FASTA format

field.name: seqs
field.label: Sequences to align
field.hint: Enter here the RNA sequences to align. Sequences have to be in FASTA format. The sequence headers must indicate the structure PDB id and the considered chain separated by an underscore (i.e. >PDBid_chain)

validation.required-error: You have to enter the sequences to align
validation.format-error: Sequences have to be in FASTA format
validation.minnum-error: You must enter at least 2 sequences

fieldset.title: Output options
fieldset.description: Use this section to control the output format.

field.name: output
field.label: Alignment format
field.hint: Specifies the format used for outputting the result MSA
field.choices: score_html, clustalw_aln, fasta_aln, score_ascii, msf_aln, phylip, score_pdf

field.name: letter
field.label: Case
field.hint: Causes the output alignment to contain only upper case, lower case or to keep the original letters formatting

field.name: seqnos
field.label: Residue number
field.hint: Causes the output alignment to contain residue numbers at the end of each line

field.name: outorder
field.label: Output order
field.hint: Sets the order of the sequences in the output alignment: 'input' means the sequences are kept in the original order; 'aligned' means the sequences come in the order indicated by the tree

field.name: msa_max_len
field.label: Alignment length
field.hint: The max number of columns of the result alignment, after that the alignment returns to a new line

validation.format-error: The entered value is not an integer number
validation.min-error: The length value cannot be less than 20

field.name: email
field.label: Your email address
field.hint: It will be used to notify you on alignment completion. Multiple email addresses can be entered by separating them with commas

tcoffee.script: export X3DNA=${settings.saracoffee.X3DNA}; export PDB_DIR=${settings.saracoffee.PDB_DIR}; export NO_REMOTE_PDB_DIR=1; unset MAFFT_BINARIES; (cd $CACHE_4_TCOFFEE; ln -s ${settings.saracoffee.HOME}/pdb_entry_type.txt); t_coffee \ -in ${seqs} \ -method sara_pair \ -template_file ${settings.saracoffee.TEMPLATE_FILE},RNA \ -extend_mode rna2 \ -relax_lib 0 \ -transform dna2rna \ -run_name=result \ -output ${output} \ -case=${letter} \ -seqnos=${seqnos} \ -outorder=${outorder} \ -multi_core=${settings.multicore} \ -pdb_min_sim 0 \ -quiet stdout

service.name: irmsd
service.title: iRMSD-APDB
service.description: Evaluates Multiple Sequence Alignment using structural information with APDB and iRMSD.

fieldset.title: Alignment input
fieldset.description: Paste or upload your Multiple Sequence Alignment in CLUSTAL format.

field.name: alignment
field.label: Alignment
field.hint: Enter your alignment

validation.required-error: You have to enter the sequences to evaluate
validation.format-error: Sequences have to be in CLUSTAL format
validation.minnum-error: You must enter at least 2 sequences
validation.maxnum-error: You can enter at most 150 sequences

fieldset.title: Srad - the Sphere Radius
fieldset.description: APDB is a local method and the structural neighbourhood of each residue is used to estimate its alignment accuracy. This Neighbourhood is a sphere of radius Srad (in Ångström). A sphere with a 10 Ångström Radius contains between 20-40 amino acids.

field.name: srad
field.label: Srad
field.hint: Set Srad, the Sphere radius (Ångström). High Srad <=> More stringent measure

fieldset.title: T1 - the Distance Threshold
fieldset.description: Within a sphere, each pair of aligned residues either agrees or disagrees with the central residues alignment. Pairs of aligned residues whose difference of distance (Delta) is lower than T1 are considered to be supportive, pairs of residues above T1 are considered unsupportive.

field.name: t1
field.label: T1
field.hint: T1 (Ångström) the Delta Threshold. Low T1 <=> More stringent measure.

fieldset.title: T2 - the Neighbourhood Support
fieldset.description: The final APDB score indicates the proportion of aligned residues correctly aligned from an APDB point of view. APDB considers that a pair of residues is correctly aligned if T2 percent of its neighbourhood is supportive (as defined above in the T1 section).

field.name: t2
field.label: T2
field.hint: T2 (%) The Neighbourhood Support Limit. Hight T2 <=> More stringent Measure.

field.name: email
field.label: Your email address
field.hint: It will be used to notify you on alignment completion. Multiple email addresses can be entered by separating them with commas.

fieldset.description: Select the methods you want to use to compute the library. T-Coffee uses various sequence and structure alignment methods to compile a collection of alignments known as a Library. Use this section to select the methods.

field.name: method2
field.label: Multiple Methods
field.choices: pcma_msa, mafft_msa, clustalw_msa, dialigntx_msa, poa_msa, muscle_msa, probcons_msa, t_coffee_msa, amap_msa, kalign_msa, fsa_msa, probconsRNA_msa, mus4_msa

field.name: method3
field.label: Pairwise Methods
field.choices: best_pair4prot, fast_pair, clustalw_pair, lalign_id_pair, slow_pair, proba_pair

fieldset.title: PDB structure selection

...
